description.value:
Totem of Bear

Totem Spirit (War) — Creation Cost: 8 Gnosis

Spirit Aspect: Endurance / Protection / Ferocity

Individual Trait

The creature who touches the Totem gains the following benefit until the next long rest:

  • You gain advantage on Constitution saving throws
  • When you would be reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you may instead drop to 1 hit point (once per long rest)

Only one creature may benefit from this trait at a time.

Pack Trait

As an action, a creature touching the Totem may invoke Bear's presence.

For 1 minute, while within 20 feet of the Totem:

  • Pack members gain temporary hit points equal to their proficiency bonus at the start of each of their turns
  • Pack members have advantage on saving throws against being frightened or stunned

This represents Bear's refusal to yield ground.

Ban — Endure the Wound

Bear demands fortitude and shared suffering.

The pack must not abandon a fight or retreat while an ally is still standing and able to continue, when withdrawal is not immediately necessary to prevent total annihilation.

If the pack flees prematurely or leaves allies behind to spare itself harm, the Totem becomes dormant and all its benefits cease.

To restore the Totem, the pack leader must reinvest the required Gnosis cost to reaffirm the bond.

If the pack repeatedly or egregiously violates this Ban, Bear may withdraw entirely, permanently severing itself from the Totem at the Storyteller's discretion.

Totem rules: Only one Totem per pack; benefits do not stack; a dormant Totem provides no benefits. Once a Totem benefit is used, it cannot be used again until after a long rest. Interacting with a Totem requires 1 action while touching it; choose either the Individual Trait or the Pack Trait.
